page.title: 01Thrumster
page.content: Thrumster is a small village on the A9 trunk road approx.12km.S. of Wick and 25km.S.E.of Thurso the two main towns in Caithness -the most northernly county in Scotland.The name is of Viking origin as also are those of the inhabitants of the area. The farming land which has been reclaimed from a peaty podzol is gently undulating and of an arable/semi-arable/moorland type The coastline is 50m. cliffs cut into caves and geos by the North Sea. Population: 230 Housing: Council-56 Private-6 Occupations: Farming. Service Industry Services: Shop/P.O.School,Garage,Hall, Public Playing Field,Call Box Communications: A9 Main Rd.Bus service Temperature: Summer-below national av. Winter-mild Lochs:One freshwater-area 1sq.km.
